page.title: 14Changes in Hazelbury Bryan
page.content: Not much has changed in the landscape of Hazelbury Bryan over the years. However, people keep themselves very much to themselves nowadays, and I blame television. Country crafts are almost a thing of the past. It is not like the old days when all was quiet all day. Now cars and motorbikes tear about, creating havoc. The children are still as cheerful as ever, although they lack discipline. Clothes are better in quality and design, but people seem to wear anything. Shopping is difficult, with only a general store in the village. The bus service is poor, it doesn't give us enough time to shop. If I had my way, I'd bring back the horse and cart, stop people modernising the fronts of old houses, and use cheaper materials for houses so that young families could settle.
